definition: to write in the style of some author/to write as if from the mouth of sb/a pastiche
to plan to/to draft (a plan)/to imitate/to assess/to compare/pseudo-
doubtful/suspicious/variant of 擬|拟[ni3]/to emulate/to imitate
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: This product is not intended to be used as a magnesium supplement.
sentences.chinese: 此产品不拟作为镁的补充。

sentences.english: He's going on (or is making) a long journey.
The Baohe Reservoir is planned to be one of the regulating reservoirs for South to North Water Transfer project (middle route).
sentences.chinese: 瀑河水库拟作为南水北调中线的一个调蓄水库。

sentences.english: Summer mosquitoes into the mine, the private group intended for the empty.
sentences.chinese: 夏蚊成雷，私拟作群鹤舞空。

sentences.english: As a rhetoric act, imitation is a cognitive one as well.
sentences.chinese: 拟作为一种修辞行为，也是一种认知活动。

definition: to write a poem on the order of the Emperor
third and fourth lines (in an eight-line poem) which form a couplet
to recount what happened prior to events already known
